reviews.text: Came here by accident via the wrong train but the very friendly staff nicely directed me home. Sweet little station with some nice artwork.

Not really much to say about the station. Very simple and basic. They have a self service ticket machine, however the touch screen can be very frustrating to use. If the staff is present they're always friendly. 

The thing to note to reach one of the platforms, you need to exit the station and turn right and walk up to reach the platform. People usually become very confused about this.

It's located close to the street and shopping areas around Smethwick however the station is much less accessible than the nearby and busier Smethwick Galton Bridge station. No step free access is possible here and the station has less seating and shelter. Trains stop at this poor looking station every 30 minutes towards Wolverhampton and Walsall.
Close to the Indian VISA Office
